meanings.definition: Cause (someone) to feel ashamed or foolish.
meanings.sent1: Bullying someone in front of others humiliates them.
meanings.sent2: The mean comments from the bully humiliates the victim.
meanings.sent3: The clown's silly dance routine humiliates the serious magician.
meanings.sent4: Losing the game in front of the whole school humiliates him.
meanings.sent5: The public rejection speech humiliates her beyond words.

meanings.definition: Lower the pride, dignity, or self-respect of.
meanings.sent1: Constant criticism can really humiliates a person.
meanings.sent2: The harsh words from the coach humiliates the player.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy humiliates the proud cat by stealing its toy.
meanings.sent4: The defeat in the final match humiliates the team's spirit.
meanings.sent5: The failure in the exam humiliates his confidence in his abilities.
